subject: Re: Freelance Native German Linguist
body:
Dear Language & Culture Worldwide Team,
I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding freelance linguist and translation services. I am eager to explore potential opportunities to collaborate on your upcoming projects.
Please let me know if there is a convenient time to discuss further.
--
Dieter Hillert
On March 07, 2025 03:25, Dieter Hillert 
<
looppouls@gmail.com
>
 wrote:
Dear Language & Culture Worldwide Team,
I am writing to offer my freelance services as an experienced linguist and translator Below are key highlights of my expertise:
Language Pairs:
 German < > English
Domains:
 Medical, Technical, IT, Business, General
Key Clients:
 HP, IBM, Boeing, Microsoft, VW
CAT Tools:
 SDL Studio, Trados, MemoQ, AWS, etc.
With over 15 years of experience, I am confident in delivering high-quality, accurate translations tailored to your needs.
I would be delighted to discuss potential collaboration opportunities. Please feel free to reach out to me at your convenience.
--
Dieter Hillert

subject: Re: Application for Freelance Translator Position at Language & Culture Worldwide
body:
Hello Language & Culture Worldwide Team,
I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to follow up on my application for the freelance translator position (English to Japanese) one last time. I remain very interested in the opportunity to contribute my skills and experience to your team.
If there have been any developments or if there's anything else you need from me, please let me know. Otherwise, I understand and will wait for the next steps from your end. I plan to reach out again after six months if I haven't heard back by then.
Thank you once again for considering my application. I appreciate your time and consideration.
Thank You
Masahiro Fukuda

subject: Certified Arabic Translator & DTPer
body:
Hello Sir/Madam,
 
My name is Ahmed Mahany, I am a professional qualified native Arabic translator and editor. I am a native speaker of Arabic language with a diploma in Translation. 
I have 21 years of various experience in 
Translation, Localization, Proofreading, Subtitling, and Voice-Over
.
 
It would be a pleasure to join your team as a freelance translator from 
English into Arabic
 and 
Arabic into English
.
 
I assure you of my attractive style in writing and high accuracy in typing and formatting, in addition to flexibility, adherence to deadlines, and experience in meeting the audience's cultures and needs.

subject: Join Dr. Kellee Franklin for a Bold Conversation on AI & Work
body:
AI Meets Empathy: A Webinar You Don’t Want to Miss 
 
 
Everyone’s talking about AI. 
But how many are talking about the people behind it?
On 
Tuesday, April 8
, we’re bringing you a very different kind of conversation, one that puts 
humans
 at the center of the AI revolution. 
We’re joined by 
Dr. Kellee Franklin,
 innovation strategist, educator, and someone who’s spent years helping leaders rethink what transformation really looks like. 
Together, we’ll dig into questions like:
What does a truly human-centric workplace look like in the age of AI? 
How do we empower people to grow 
with
 technology, not around it? 
And what are the global companies getting right about the Human+AI advantage?
      
Date: 
Tuesday, April 08, 2025
Time:
 
 11 AM Eastern / 3 PM UTC 
Speaker: 
 Dr. Kellee Franklin 
Register Now 
      
Because the 
mission
 of the AInMB is to empower innovation across the entire business enterprise, it is structured to presents the knowledge of business innovation. 
Get Your Copy 
 
      
Catch up on innovation insights! Rewatch 
GInI webinars now!
 
Learn More 
      
 
Visit our website now to discover how you can access your 
complimentary 
 
copy of the 
GInI Innovation
Glossary
.
Get Your Copy

Facebook

subject: Professional Video Translation Services in Indian Languages
body:
Dear Team,
I hope this email finds you well.
My name is Sanjay Ray, a PROZ Certified PRO with 72 WWA endorsements and a proud member of the ATA. I lead a dedicated team of experienced translators specializing in Indian languages, including Urdu, Bengali, Punjabi, Gujarati, and Hindi.
We provide a comprehensive range of services, including video translation, transcription, subtitling, voice-over, and document translation. Our expertise ensures accurate and culturally nuanced translations, helping you effectively reach diverse audiences.
If you require professional support in any of these languages, I would be delighted to discuss how we can collaborate. Please feel free to save my contact details for future reference: 
info@indianscripts.com
.
Thank you for considering Indianscripts for your linguistic needs. I look forward to the opportunity to work with your team.
Warm regards,
Sanjay Ray, PhD
info@indianscripts.com

subject: Join a Global Innovation Community by April 15
body:
Thank you for being part of the 
2025 Global Innovation Summit
. Your presence and engagement helped shape meaningful conversations that are still resonating today.
To keep that momentum alive, we’re inviting you to join the
 
Global Innovation Communities
;a space where those conversations evolve into deeper collaboration. The deadline to register is 
April 15
.
Sign up 
If you haven’t registered yet, we encourage you to do so by 
April 15
.
Why Join?
These communities connect professionals and thought leaders across sectors to explore today’s most pressing innovation themes, including:
Digital Transformation & Emerging Technologies
 
Sustainability & Climate Innovation
 
Smart Cities & Urban Development
 
Healthcare & Well-being Innovation
 
Education & Lifelong Learning
 
Finance & FinTech Innovation
 
Innovation in Government Services
 
Innovation in Community Impact & Civic Engagement
You’ll join monthly sessions to share insights and strategies, and every quarter, gain fresh perspectives from 
Summit President Anthony Mills
 on emerging global trends.
We’re also launching a unique new tool
:
The 
Innovator Psychometric Profiling Tool
, which helps participants identify their innovation strengths and leadership styles. 
 
    
    
Follow us on Social Media
 
Facebook
 
Twitter
 
LinkedIn
 
Instagram

subject: eLearning Africa News - March 2025 Edition
body:
Web Version
Dear eLearning Africa Community,
Momentum is building with only 7 weeks to go until 
eLearning Africa 2025
! This month we explore the highlights of Africa’s leading learning event; from the much-anticipated Preliminary Programme release to a special feature on UNICEF’s transformational ‘Learning Pioneers Programme’ (LPP). A digital education initiative.  We also spotlight the MoodleMoot Tanzania pre-conference event and an insightful conversation with Poncelet Ileleji which tackles AI, open data and the challenges of sustainable EdTech innovation in Africa. The countdown is on! Are you ready?
MoodleMoot Tanzania 2025: Join Africa’s Leading LMS at eLearning Africa!
Explore What’s Ahead!  The eLearning Africa 2025 Preliminary Programme is Here - 50+ Sessions, Debates & More!
AI, Innovation & EdTech: Poncelet Ileleji on Africa’s Digital Future
Countdown to eLearning Africa 2025 - Just 7 Weeks to Go!
Building Tomorrow’s Classrooms: UNICEF’s Learning Pioneers Programme (LPP) at eLearning Africa 2025
MoodleMoot Tanzania 2025: Join Africa’s Leading LMS at eLearning Africa!
MoodleMoot Tanzania
 will take place on May 7, 2025, as a Pre-Conference Workshop at eLearning Africa. This interactive, full-day event will bring together Moodle experts and partners to explore the latest innovations, best practices and case studies from across the continent. Whether you're an educator, administrator, or developer, this is your chance to learn, connect, and grow with Africa’s leading LMS. 
Register here.
Explore What’s Ahead!  The eLearning Africa 2025 Preliminary Programme is Here - 50+ Sessions, Debates & More!
The eLearning Africa 2025 Preliminary Programme is now available! With over 50 expert-led sessions, interactive debates and hands-on workshops.  This year’s agenda offers a deep dive into the most critical topics shaping education across the continent. Attendees can explore AI in education, TVET reform, digital inclusion, climate resilience, and more, gaining insights from thought leaders and industry pioneers.
View the preliminary programme here.
AI, Innovation & EdTech: Poncelet Ileleji on Africa’s Digital Future
With over 25 years of experience in ICT for Development, Poncelet Ileleji has been at the forefront of Africa’s digital transformation. In this exclusive interview with eLearning Africa, he shares insights on AI governance, digital infrastructure, and the future of EdTech start ups - plus, what an AI version of himself would do better (and worse!). See the full interview 
here.
Countdown to eLearning Africa 2025 - Just 7 Weeks to Go!
Excitement is building for eLearning Africa 2025! From May 7-9, we will host more than 235 speakers, over 1,200 participants, 50+ sessions, and attendees from more than 80 countries in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Prominent world-wide organisations and industry pioneers will be joining us – so now is the time to secure your spot at Africa’s leading learning event. 
Register here.
Building Tomorrow’s Classrooms: UNICEF’s Learning Pioneers Programme (LPP) at eLearning Africa 2025
UNICEF’s Learning Pioneers Programme (LPP) is transforming education across Africa, equipping students and teachers with AI and EdTech solutions. This two-year initiative is mapping and scaling inclusive digital learning in Egypt, Ghana, Rwanda, and Zimbabwe. Join UNICEF at eLearning Africa 2025 to find out more about this great initiative and be a part of their interactive session on Architects of the Future of Learning. Read the full article 
here
.
In Collaboration with:
Diamond Partner
Platinum Partners
Gold Partners
Silver Partners
Bronze Partners
Co-Hosted by
Ministry of Education, Science and Technology Tanzania

subject: Last Chance to Join an Innovation Community – Deadline April 15
body:
Thank you for being part of 
Global Innovation Summit 2025
, where global innovators came together to shape what’s next. 
As a follow-up to our recent invitation, we want to remind you that the deadline to join the 
Global Innovation Communities
 is 
April 15
. 
These communities offer an opportunity to continue the discussions and collaborations started at the summit, allowing participants to stay engaged with key innovation themes throughout the year.
What to Expect
The
 
Innovation Communities
 
bring together professionals and thought leaders from diverse fields to explore challenges, trends, and opportunities in:
Digital Transformation & Emerging Technologies
Sustainability & Climate Innovation
Smart Cities & Urban Development
Healthcare & Well-being Innovation
Education & Lifelong Learning
Finance & FinTech Innovation
Innovation in Government Services
Innovation in Community Impact & Civic Engagement
Members meet 
monthly
 to share insights, while 
quarterly sessions
 with Summit President Anthony Mills provide additional perspectives on emerging trends.Additionally, we are developing the  
Innovator Psychometric Profiling Tool
, 
designed to help participants assess their innovation strengths and leadership styles. If you’d like to take part, you can indicate your interest when registering.
If you haven’t signed up yet, please complete your registration by
 
April 15
 
using the button below. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out.
Sign up 
 
    
    
Follow us on Social Media
 
Facebook

subject: Global Innovation Summit 2025 and Key Innovation Partnerships
body:
The 
Global Innovation Summit 2025
 concluded as a landmark event, bringing together 
industry leaders, government officials, and pioneers
 to explore the future of innovation.
Strategic MoUs to Advance Innovation
During the summit, GInI formalized several key 
Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs)
Saudi Innovation Club
 A joint effort to enhance 
innovation programs, knowledge exchange, and skills development in Saudi Arabia
.
 
 
      
Community Development Authority (CDA), Dubai
A partnership aimed at 
transforming government services through innovation and future-ready policies
.
 
 
      
Ajman Municipality
A shared initiative to 
promote innovation in governance and drive public sector excellence
.
 
 
      
Expanding Innovation in South East Asia
Beyond the summit, 
GInI continues to exp
and its global footprint with the launch of the 
GInI Indonesia Center
 
in
 
Jakarta. In partnership with
 
PT. Mitra Inovasi Prima Indonesia
, the center will provide
 
direct access to GInI’s innovation certification and accreditation programs
, further strengthening
 
Indonesia’s role in the global innovation landscape.
 
      
Because the 
mission
 of the AInMB is to empower innovation across the entire business enterprise, it is structured to presents the knowledge of business innovation. 
Get Your Copy 
 
      
Catch up on innovation insights! Rewatch 
GInI webinars now!

subject: Re: Application for Freelance Translator Position at Language & Culture Worldwide
body:
Hello Language & Culture Worldwide Team,
I recently applied for the freelance translator position (English to Japanese) at your organization and wanted to follow up on my application.
I am very enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute my extensive translation experience and diverse background in various fields to your team. I am particularly interested in how my skills align with the needs of your organization.
Could you please provide an update on the status of my application? If there are any additional materials or information you require from me, please let me know.
I look forward to your response.
Thank You
Masahiro Fukuda
  
On March 05, 2025 04:13, Masahiro Fukuda 
<
fmasahjapan@gmail.com
>
 wrote:
Hello Language & Culture Worldwide Team,
I hope this email finds you well.
I am Masahiro
 
Fukuda, interested in the freelance translator position for English to Japanese at your organization. With over 15 years of translation experience and a diverse background in marketing, IT, video games, law, and more, I deliver precise and high-quality translations.
Highlights:
450,000+ words translated/proofread.
Managed 6.7 million words in editing/proofreading.
Specialized in creative translation for travel and hospitality (52,000+ words) and video game localization (46,000+ words).
Background:
Precise, thorough, and adaptive.
Strong communicator and quick learner.
Proficient in Trados Studio, Xbench, MateCAT, Memsource, and more.
I am eager to contribute to your organization.
Please find my resume attached for your consideration.
Thank You
Masahiro Fukuda

My name is Sanjay Ray, a PROZ Certified PRO with 72 WWA endorsements and a proud member of the ATA. I lead a dedicated team of experienced translators specializing in Indian languages, including Urdu, Bengali, Punjabi, Gujarati, and Hindi.

subject: Re: Your March Update from LCW: Celebrating Women’s History Month—and Continuing Our Commitment to Inclusion
body:
Hi LCW, 
Thank you for the amazing newsletter! 
I did want to share a resource that I created that might be helpful to you all with your focus on cultural differences. 
Please find the 2025 global DEI calendar 
here
. It may help inform your content. 
Take care, 
Diya 
On Tue, Mar 11, 2025 at 3:36 PM LCW <
info@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
We've got lots of exciting things coming up at LCW - including a Webinar on March 27th, and a special April session specifically focused on the changing landscape of the DEI industry. We hope you join us.
 
Hello Diya
 
As we turn the page on Black History Month and move into Women’s History Month, we’re reminded that the pursuit of equity, respect, and understanding is not confined to a single date on the calendar. It’s a continuous effort, fueled by reflection and intentional growth. At LCW, we’re dedicated to helping organizations like yours foster inclusive, supportive environments for every identity—and we’re excited to share what’s next on our journey together.
 
Women's History Month: Celebrating Resilience & Empowering Change
March is here, and with it, a special opportunity to spotlight the countless achievements and invaluable contributions of women in history. Whether they’ve broken barriers, championed justice, or paved new paths in leadership, women’s stories inspire us to think bigger and act bolder. This month, we’re challenging ourselves—and our community—to amplify women’s voices, learn from their experiences, and empower them in all spaces, from boardrooms to classrooms.
 
Upcoming Events at LCW
 
Beyond Barriers: Championing Inclusion for Trans and Nonbinary Colleagues
,
 (March 27th, 12-12:45pm ET / 11-11:45am CT)
 "Join us for an insightful webinar on transgender and nonbinary identities, where we’ll unpack terminology, challenge stereotypes, and explore strategies for workplace inclusion. Let’s work together to break biases and become stronger allies."
Register Here
 
 
COMING IN APRIL: Navigating the Evolving DEI Landscape -
 How can organizations navigate the future of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in today’s polarized climate? Join us as we examine pressing challenges, spotlight emerging trends, and share actionable insights designed to keep your people at the very heart of your organizational strategy. 
A large number of you have expressed interest in learning more about what's happening in the DEI space, so we'll be sending out a separate invite for this event soon!
 
Learning with LCW: Fostering Belonging & Leading Inclusively
If you’re seeking practical tips on fostering a culture of respect and belonging, check out our blog
 
Three Proven Steps for Leading Inclusively
. This resource outlines powerful strategies to:
Build trust and model inclusive behaviors
Empower diverse voices and encourage collaboration
Sustain and measure long-term change
 
Services Spotlight: Comprehensive Training Solutions for Every Learner
At LCW, we recognize that every team learns differently. That’s why we provide multiple paths to equip your organization with the skills and knowledge needed for sustainable inclusivity:
A dynamic on-demand library for self-paced learning
Toolkits to spark discussion and guide practical action
Microlearning modules to embed quick, impactful lessons
Facilitated trainings led by our expert team
We tailor each experience to your unique needs, ensuring that your team remains at the forefront of inclusive leadership. Let’s build an environment where every person feels empowered and valued.
 
A Thought to Carry Forward
As we continue to place our employees at the forefront of our mission, we commit to ongoing reflection and growth, ensuring our strategies evolve with the needs of our team and community. Each of us has the power to shape a workplace—and a world—defined by equity, respect, and opportunity for all. How can you stretch yourself, your team, and your organization this month?
 
We’re here to support you every step of the way. Reach out if you have any questions, or register for our upcoming events to continue your learning journey.
 
The LCW Team
 
 
March 27th Webinar Signup
 
 
 
LCW leverages over two decades of experience helping your people communicate, collaborate, and succeed across cultural differences with cost-effective training and consulting solutions.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2025 LCW, All rights reserved.
LCW, 4753 N Broadway, Floor 2, Chicago, Illinois 60640, USA

subject: Invitation to Join a Global Innovation Community
body:
On behalf of the 
2025 Global Innovation Summit (GInS) team
, we would like to express our sincere appreciation for your participation in this year’s event. Your engagement helped make 
GInS 2025
 a success, bringing together global thought leaders, experts, and innovators to shape the future of innovation.
To ensure the conversations and collaborations continue beyond the summit, we are launching 
Innovation Communities
—dedicated groups designed to facilitate ongoing dialogue, knowledge exchange, and strategic insights in key innovation areas.
Innovation Communities & Focus Areas
Digital Transformation & Emerging Technologies
Sustainability & Climate Innovation 
Smart Cities & Urban Development
Healthcare & Well-being Innovation 
Education & Lifelong Learning
Finance & FinTech Innovation 
Innovation in Government Services
Innovation in Community Impact & Civic Engagement 
Each 
Innovation Community
 will convene 
monthly
, with 
quarterly engagements
 led by 
Summit President Anthony Mills
 to provide additional insights and strategic direction. Each group will also have a 
volunteer leader
 to facilitate discussions and ensure valuable exchanges.
The 
GInI Innovator Psychometric Profiling Tool 
As part of our commitment to advancing innovation, 
Global Innovation Institute
 is developing a 
new Innovator Psychometric Profiling Tool
. This tool will provide participants with personalized insights into their innovation potential, leadership style, and problem-solving approach.
